questions.question: What is the primary cause of increased eutrophication in freshwater ecosystems?
Which of the following is an example of an ecosystem engineer?
Which of the following factors contribute to the decline of coral reef ecosystems?
Which of the following best describes the process of ecological succession?
options: A series of changes in species composition over time
A rapid decline in species diversity
The cyclical patterns of species migration
The seasonal changes in an ecosystem
questions.correct_answer: A series of changes in species composition over time

questions.question: What is the main difference between primary and secondary succession?
options: Primary succession occurs after a natural disaster
Secondary succession begins with the formation of soil
Primary succession begins on bare rock
Secondary succession occurs faster than primary succession
questions.correct_answer: Primary succession begins on bare rock

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of carrying capacity?
options: The maximum number of individuals an ecosystem can support indefinitely
The rate at which a population increases or decreases
The total number of species in an ecosystem
The minimum number of individuals needed for a population to survive
questions.correct_answer: The maximum number of individuals an ecosystem can support indefinitely

questions.question: What is the main reason for species loss in tropical rainforests?
Which of the following is an example of a density-dependent limiting factor?
What is the primary reason that wetlands are important ecosystems?
options: They provide habitat for endangered species
They act as natural water filters
They store large amounts of carbon
questions.correct_answer: They act as natural water filters

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of mutualism?
